channel.title: Islamic State
channel.description: Islamic State is a radical Islamist group which has seized territory across northern and western Iraq and eastern Syria.
channel.copyright: ℗ & © 2015 of Telegraph Media Group Limited. Please refer to the Terms and Conditions of Use at http://www.telegraph.co.uk/rss

item.title: Syria air strikes: Isil feel "the full force" of the RAF in new bombing assault
item.description: Typhoons, Tornados, and unmanned Reaper drones launch fresh bombing raids against Islamic State as Defence Secretary Michael Fallon tells RAF crews they have the backing of "the people of Britain"
item.author: Tim Ross

item.title: RAF jets target Syria oilfield in new air strikes
item.description: Typhoons, Tornados, and unmanned Reaper drones launch fresh bombing raids against Islamic State as Defence Secretary Michael Fallon tells RAF crews they have the backing of "the people of Britain"
item.author: Tim Ross

item.title: Our secret weapon in the war against Isil... Stephen Fry
item.description: Could the celebrated raconteur, TV personality and geopolitical commentator hold the key to preventing an attack on Britain?
item.author: Michael Deacon

item.title: Paris attack terrorists 'had links to extremists in Britain'
item.description: Terrorist visited London and Birmingham in run up to Islamic State-inspired Paris attacks which killed 130 people
item.author: Barney Henderson

item.title: Isil antiques 'sold to western collectors' warns French finance minister
item.description: French finance minister calls for stricter controls to prevent Isil profiting from illicit trade in antiquities plundered from sites such as Palmyra in Syria
item.author: Telegraph Staff

item.title: Germany 'draws up plans to prevent sharing intelligence' with Nato ally Turkey
item.description: German commanders fear Ankara may use intelligence of its flights to target Kurdish forces allied to the West
item.author: Justin Huggler

item.title: Germany joins fight against Isil after parliament approves military action in Syria
item.description: Berlin approves sending Tornado reconnaissance jets and up to 1,200 military personnel but it will not join coalition air strikes
item.author: Reuters

item.title: Islamic State terror squad 'in Thailand' planning to kill Russians, warns Moscow
item.description: Ten-person terrorist squad entered the Kingdom in October on a mission to target Russians, Moscow warns
item.author: Roland Oliphant

item.title: Isil 'aims to attack UK next', claims report as intelligence agencies 'fear fallout from air strikes on Syria'
item.description: Defence secretary Michael Fallon says UK air strikes in Syria could last three years as RAF focus bomb attacks on Isil's oil fields
item.author: Barney Henderson

item.title: Oldham by-election: did Muslims worried about war in Syria save Jeremy Corbyn from doom?
item.description: The Labour leader's strong stance on military intervention may have helped secure his victory in Oldham West and Royton
item.author: Asa Bennett

item.title: Isil's oil trade shows the limits of airpower
item.description: Telegraph View: Britain is finally playing its proper part in the military campaign, but victory will require much more than force
item.author: Telegraph View

item.title: Jeremy Corbyn has made us targets for jihadists, shadow cabinet member warns
item.description: The Labour leader is accused of leaving his MPs open to revenge attacks following the vote to back air strikes against Isil jihadists in Syria.
item.author: Peter Dominiczak

item.title: Awful though it seems, working with Assad may be the only option in Syria
item.description: Having won the day on air strikes, Mr Cameron may have to compromise on his desire for regime change
item.author: Fraser Nelson

item.title: 'Russian spy' beheaded by Isil was an 'orphan pressured into spying'
item.description: Magomed Khasiev, 23, was beheaded by one of his own countrymen in a video released this week
item.author: Roland Oliphant

item.title: France wants to change constitution to extend powers in state of emergency
item.description: François Hollande intends to change the constitution to extend the powers allowed the government in a state of emergency and enable it to strip citizenship from dual nationals born in France
item.author: Henry Samuel

item.title: It's 'happy holidays in Syria' according to the Assad regime
item.description: Even as British MPs vote to carry out airstrikes on Syria, the regime of Bashar al-Assad is attempting to promote the country to visitors
item.author: Lizzie Porter

item.title: Hilary Benn's speech - and an insult that shames Alex Salmond
item.description: POLITICAL SKETCH: After the Syria vote, the shadow foreign secretary was the talk of Westminster - but the acclaim wasn't exactly universal
item.author: Michael Deacon

item.title: Hilary Benn's speech was the speech of a true leader
item.description: The great pre-battle speech is a form of outburst - you go into a trance-like state to exhort, explain, and convince. Benn has just just that
item.author: Col Tim Collins

item.title: Isil's terror network will crumble without its oil revenues
item.description: For some unexplained reason coalition warplanes have steered clear of actively targeting Isil's oil supply lines
item.author: Con Coughlin

item.title: France wants power to extend state of emergency to 'maximum of six months'
item.description: François Hollande intends to change the constitution to extend the current three-month limit on a state of emergency and introduce new powers to tackle terror threats
item.author: Henry Samuel
